story:
FLASH AH-AHHH!!!!

The Rock & Roll Parody Musical of Flash Gordon Featuring the Music and Songs of QUEEN!

My name is Steve Coker.  I am the creator and producer of Flash Ah-Ahhh!!!  I live in Portland Oregon and have been producing original works and parody stage productions for the past six years. Our first two productions were live adaptations of my own original works: Varsity Cheerleader Werewolves From Outer Space:

And then The Adventures of Dex Dixon: Paranormal Dick.  A Noir, Horror, Comedy Musical...

After that we started working on Parodies of 80s and 90s comedies such as: Xanadu, John Water's Cry-Baby and The Three Amigos.  We have had great successes with all of our shows... but Flash Ah-Ahhh!! seems to be tho one people most gravitate to.  Each time we run it, people will pay to see the show several times. One person even bought a ticket for every performance in 2016.

We are going to mount Flash Ah-Ahhh!!! in November this year... it will be the fifth anniversary of the show and seemed the perfect time to bring back many of the original cast.  It is our goal to make the costumes and props better than ever and to film a professional 4 camera shoot of the show to use for proof of concept to producers and investors. We'd love to see this show get all the attention it deserves. 

  • A wider audience for such an incredible show..
  • The ability to obtain the music rights for the 14 Queen songs featured in the show.
  • Possible productions outside the Pacific Northwest.
  • And really, just a kick ass video to share.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $5000.00 for this production.  We will be spending the funds in the following ways:

  • $3000.00 for Video Production Costs: 
    • Camera/Sound Rentals
    • Proficient Professional Crew
  • $2000.00 for Stage Production Costs
    • $500.00 for Costume Design and construction
    • $150.00 for Prop Design and construction
    • $500.00 Printing of fliers, posters and handbills
    • $350.00 for Print/Media Advertising
  • For your generous contribution, you will receive some fun merchandise and perks... listed on the Fund Project page.
  • If we do not achieve the entire amount we are seeking, we will still use the funds for the show and we will still make a video, but the quality of the camera equipment may need to be of lesser value.  IF we make more than the set goal, we will apply it toward increasing the quality of the production, additional promotional materials and to pay our cast and crew for their talent and time.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in investing in artistic endeavors, but i can assure you that I know how to budget and use funds in amazing ways.  Generally I create impactful productions with limited budgets. I was the Production Manager for Chambers Productions/KEZI News in Eugene and was constantly working under high time pressure and budget restraints.  I have a long record of producing quality work on a budget. You can feel safe knowing your contribution will go to making the finest quality production possible

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometime people aren't in the position to contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this project page with people in your world... friends, neighbors and business leaders who might resonate with this project.  You can easily do that by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Voulenteer some time to help us put up fliers.  
  • Or maybe you'd like to usher.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration.  Help us achieve our goals and bring Flash Ah-Ahhh!!! to life once more.

story:
HOW TO HELP "HERE OR THERE: A NEW MUSICAL"

Matt Clark and Liam Searcy (with help from Jordy Searcy) are bringing a new musical to life. We need your help- the next step for our show to come to life is paying an arranger to help chart the chords we have for the song into real-life sheet music. Arrangers charge roughly $100 a song, and with 8 songs in "Here or There" that's an $800 expense. We truly believe in this project, and any help is greatly appreciated.

 

"Here or There" follows Kate, in the bus station of the small town she's called home for the past 28 years as she decides whether or not to get on the bus out of town- leaving her life behind her, and starting fresh. Throughout the course of the one-act musical, featuring 8 brand new songs by Liam Searcy, Kate discovers more of who she is as she's forced to face her past, present, and future.

 

Anyone who donates will receive a personalized thank you message from the first rehearsal after we have sheet music, as well as an inside look at us playing the music off of sheet music for the first time!

story:
Summary

Produced largely by soon to be graduates of the Ryerson School of Performance, Rhinoceros is the culmination of four years of learning and work. Our team is looking to stretch our wings away from a school setting and put our skills to the test in creating a challenging and thought provoking work of art on stage. However we can't do it alone. We are dependent on the help of people like you to fund this project and create a show that is as powerful and effective as our current vision is.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All funds from our Indiegogo campaign will go directly towards what you will see on stage. Every dollar contributed will be used to put beautiful sets, costumes, and lighting into the show. Even if our goal isn't met, we will make the most of what we have and bring you the best show possible. 

 

The Impact

Art can change the world and by contributing you are not only helping to put meaningful art out there but also helping to hone the skills of dozens of young theater artist. 

Donating to our show will 

  • Ensure the best possible set, costumes, and lighting
  • Encourage young theatre artists to experiment and play with old works in contemporary ways
  • Enable us to tell stories that are meaningful to us, and many others.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, (it's tough out there!) but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our campaign and like/comment on our social media posts to get the word out.
  • Tell someone who may be able to throw some money our way!

We look forwards to sharing our work with all of you, April 5th-7th. Break legs!

story:
Short Summary

House of DOV has been working with collaborators over the past 9 months to create a new work entitled "delirium (honesty)" set to premiere July 23rd at the Adler Planetarium in Chicago, IL. We have brought together an incredible group of artists across mediums including dance, film, photography, fashion, and DJ. The project includes a fabulous cast of dancers Ingrid Ferdinand, Maddy Joss, Alexandra Webb, and Hannah Marcus, handmade costumes by Jeremy Miller, and live DJ set by Tushrik Fredericks. The evening of dance will also include special guests HOMESICK Productions (NY) and C-LS/Club Shamoun (NY).

What We Need

We have been so lucky to be working with various organizations to put on this event, including the Adler Planetarium, Momenta Performing Arts Company, The Academy of Movement and Music, Palette & Chisel Art Academy, and See Chicago Dance. There are many budget line items that we are asking for help with. They include:

  • Venue and Catering Fees
  • Stage Rental
  • Artist Fees
  • Handmade Costumes by Jeremy Miller
  • Travel costs for out of town performers
  • Documentation Fees
  • Sound Equipment Fees

The Impact

During a time where we all are so starved for live performance and the community energy that it creates, we feel more than ever that Chicago needs this. As a group of emerging artists, we are truly on the precipice of crossing a major threshold in our careers. After my own career performing in New York and touring nationally and internationally since graduating college in 2016, I have pivoted during this time to focus on movement research, pedagogy, and my own creations. This event is both the World Premiere of a life-giving work, but also my debut as a Chicago Dancemaker with an ensemble group. 

House of DOV is also committed to the concept of artwork as a way of forming community. That is why this performance will also be including performances by two other performing arts companies: HOMESICK Productions presenting a new solo "Show & Tell" and C-LS with the return of acclaimed work "NO FALSE IDOLS." Both companies bring an exciting and bold language of movement, and represent the ethics and commitment to community, diversity, and innovation that House of DOV holds close.

Risks & Rewards

As you can imagine, it been incredibly difficult to put together a show during the pandemic. In debuting this work I was intent on producing a live piece of performance, not something virtual. I spent months searching for an outdoor venue that could handle the capacity of a large audience, and was willing to work with me on something like this during the time of COVID. That is how we landed on the Adler Planetarium, with it's beautiful outdoor space that faces the Chicago Skyline. I hope that you will help us actualize this show and realize that, especially at a time like this, we need your help. It is always difficult getting a show off the ground, but this season has come with its own special difficulties. Help us to reimagine the possibilities of live performance in this city; the payoff is going to be incredible.

Other Ways You Can Help

TELL YOUR FRIENDS! Spread the word, look out for tickets, show up in person! Write a review, even.

story:
THE PLAY MUST GO ON line.
 

Let's Do A Play! but with Covid, HOW?
We do it On-line, at-home, with self-videoed scenes, then Stitch them together. That's How.

A collection of dedicated lovers of Elizabethan Theatre will join forces and talents to produce and premiere the new-writ Shakespearean-style comedy To Each Their Own. We bring decades of experience to our different roles: Acting, Research, Production, Composition... and are blending them to create a World together, even though we may be Continents apart.

My name is G.R. Smith. I run The Washington Shakespearean Festival. To get into the mind of an Elizabethan poet/playwright, I have written over 2,000 sonnets, and more than one Shakespearean-style script. After years of studying the elements common to Shakespeare's works, I have collected them and combined them with a new plot to create this Play. Help me move this Play from the Page to your Screen. Help make this Play a Reality.

TO EACH THEIR OWN - Shipwrecks, Resourceful Servants! Clueless Rulers. Mistaken Identities! Magic Lie-Detecting Stone Lions. Love at First Sight! Fighting! Wooing. Lessons Learned. ALL the tropes we love in Shakespeare are here. Powerful heightened language. Poetry. Song. And an instant Death sentence if the Truth comes out.
Help this story get told.
Become a Sponsor.
Earn Rewards.
Join our effort.
Be listed as a Producer, Associate Producer... 

We have $1,000.00 USD to distribute to our Cast/Crew as Honorariums (including a donation of $250.00 to the Actor's Fund (a respected 501 © 3 non-profit) in the name of the Cast/Crew. Your donations will help increase the Honorariums to each of our Merry Band.

If we can raise $600 or more, we will be able to increase Honorariums from "paying for a good lunch" to "paying for a couple DAYS of Food". That would be HUGE. If we surpass that goal, the Honorariums increase, and we put some funds towards our NEXT production.
We have a Cast & Crew of about 25, and some props and costumes to build, a Soundscape to design, and some advertising to pay for. Your support helps us Honor our Cast & Crew. Thank you.

  • Perks:

    Listing as a Producer, Executive Producer, Associate Producer, Supporter.
    Some levels being added will have actual play MERCH (like signed script copies, and some cool swag, like Logo'd T-Shirts, Cups, Spoons (good for cooking up those groceries) and more
    If we do not make our $600, our folks will still get their Honorarium = meal.
    Each $25 will raise up that Honorarium to everyone by about one dollar ($1.00).

The Impact:

The World is on Lockdown. Many of these Actors have lost the main way they have to get exposure and perfect their Craft. This Play will give them Audience (you) and bring out this Script to a larger audience as well. It is my hope that, once produced, and once the World opens up again, Shakespearean Festivals (and educational theatres) will take a look at To Each Their Own, and perhaps create a place for it in their Seasons. That is my very personal dream for this project.

  • What other projects have we done? How about working with a rapper and actor in Tanzania, who did a speech from "Merchant of Venice" after translating and performing a Rap on Benjamin Franklin... in Kiswahili? Several Music Videos mixing Sonnets with moving imagery & Text. Working with musicians and artists in Spain, Russia, San Francisco's Unwoman, an artist from Uruaguay, and more. See free examples of these, and many more productions our Sponsors have helped bring about. www.Patreon.com/GregRobin

Risks & Challenges

  • We are doing this. Our volunteers are here for the love of things Shakespearean - Poetry, Music, and a Magic Truth Telling Stone Lion. We are doing this all ON LINE, with very little if any contact between any of our staff and on-screen talent (Covid Safety!) It is difficult, but we are rising to the challenge.
  • We are being creative, and our folks are meeting all these challenges.
    See what we can do TOGETHER!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We need TECHNICAL assistance. Publicity (telling your friends to watch the finished product. Host a Viewing Party. Collect Sound Effects. Help plan, Build Props/Costumes. Hold a Camera for an Actor that happens to live near you. Make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! They have lots and they are EASY to use.

story:
Help us mark the 20th anniversary of the theatre's opening with much needed seating and disabled access.

Converted into a theatre in 1995 and run by volunteers ever since, Victoria Hall is home to a large variety of community theatre groups in, and around the Harlow area. The majority of productions are staged by local people, drawing in a huge amount of talent and expertise in both the performance side and the technical aspects of theatre.

Our current seats have been in use for 20 years. While they've held up well, they are now nowhere near the standard of comfort that any patron would expect. The seats are simply falling apart. Over the years we have re-upholstered and repaired the chairs as best we can, but sadly they have now surpassed any state of repair.

Pictured below are two of our better looking chairs.

Our local theatre and arts lovers deserve better!

The total project will cost us roughly £30,000. As a non-profit, run-by-volunteers organisation these are funds we simply don’t have. All and any funds generated by other revenues (such as hire fees) are pumped back into the buildings general maintenance, utility bills and other community theatre projects. 

We think you'll like what we've chosen after reviewing the available options.


Your support will make watching any future productions at the theatre a lot more enjoyable, without the distraction of an uncomfortable or broken seat.

What your donation covers...

One chair, inc VAT and a name plaque will cost (GBP) £250.00. We are not looking to make a profit so we are charging this as a flat rate.
The anniversary donation will go towards the cost of installation.
If we reach more than our funding target goal, we will use the additional funds to invest back into the theatre and other future projects.

So, where would you like to be seated?Once you have made your donation we will email you to confirm which seat that you would like your name plaque to appear. The availability will be offered on a first come first serve basis.
Please check the "updates" tab above for a list of all the fulfilled seating places.

Wheelchair & Disabled Access to the auditorium.

The new seating plan will fully cater for wheelchair users with removable sections towards the front and rear of the auditorium. At the moment patrons who use wheelchairs currently have to enter the auditorium via the external fire exit by the stage, or by using their own portable ramp. In addition to the seating campaign we are also seeking a sponsor for a ramp to be installed at the rear of the auditorium. 

We want to be a venue that is accessible for all, but we need your help.

The team that run the theatre:

Jared Greenall, Martin Colton, Chris Jolly, Simon Mawdsley

Caroline Peterbridge, Maria Warner, Nicola Peplow, Lorraine Perry, Kelly Cummings

Local user groups include:

The Victoria Hall Performing Arts Association

Harlow Theatre Company

East Herts Operatic Society

Class Act Theatre School

Thompson Promotions

Livewire

Half Term Productions

Sawbridgeworth Players

Harlow Hospital Radio

Razed Roof

Makin Steps Performing Arts

Tiny Tempos

The Victoria Hall Theatre UK based charity. Registered charity number 105137.
If you live in the United Kingdom you can grant us "Gift Aid" on your contribution which means we can claim an extra 25p for every £1 you give and it won't cost you any extra.
Once you have made your donation we will email you a confirmation with a form to sign and return.
Thank you, from everyone at The Victoria Hall Theatre.

One chair, inc VAT and a name plaque will cost (GBP) £250.00. We are not looking to make a profit so we are charging this as a flat rate.
The anniversary donation will go towards the cost of installation.
If we reach more than our funding target goal, we will use the additional funds to invest back into the theatre and other future projects.


So, where would you like to be seated?Once you have made your donation we will email you to confirm which seat that you would like your name plaque to appear. The availability will be offered on a first come first serve basis.

Please check the "updates" tab above for a list of all the fulfilled seating places.





Wheelchair & Disabled Access to the auditorium.
The new seating plan will fully cater for wheelchair users with removable sections towards the front and rear of the auditorium. At the moment patrons who use wheelchairs currently have to enter the auditorium via the external fire exit by the stage, or by using their own portable ramp. In addition to the seating campaign we are also seeking a sponsor for a ramp to be installed at the rear of the auditorium. We want to be a venue that is accessible for all, but we need your help.
The team that run the theatre:


Jared Greenall, Martin Colton, Chris Jolly, Simon Mawdsley
Caroline Peterbridge, Maria Warner, Nicola Peplow, Lorraine Perry, Kelly Cummings
Local user groups include:

The Victoria Hall Performing Arts Association
Harlow Theatre Company
East Herts Operatic Society
Class Act Theatre School
Thompson Promotions
Livewire
Half Term Productions
Sawbridgeworth Players
Harlow Hospital Radio
Razed Roof
Makin Steps Performing Arts
Tiny Tempos


The Victoria Hall Theatre UK based charity. Registered charity number 105137.
If you live in the United Kingdom you can grant us "Gift Aid" on your contribution which means we can claim an extra 25p for every £1 you give and it won't cost you any extra.
Once you have made your donation we will email you a confirmation with a form to sign and return.
Thank you, from everyone at The Victoria Hall Theatre.
campaign_city: Old Harlow, Essex, London, United Kingdom

story:
Who we are:

The Fearless Theatre Collaborative is a budding company of twenty-somethings who are working to give back to the community with every production. We plan to do this by partnering with organizations whose mission reflects the issues and topics raised in our performances. We also hope to become an outlet for aspiring teen actors in the Chicago community by providing a venue and inspiration for performance. 

1. What is Spring Awakening about?

In this version of Spring Awakening, we meet a group of students at a gathering in an abandoned mortuary. As the party progresses, the students navigate the maze of adolescence and are ultimately left with the choice between walking the same path as their parents or forging their own.

2. Why Spring Awakening?

In 1891 the play started riots. It was banned because of the candid way that the issues of adolescence were depicted on stage. After almost 125 years the world has changed drastically, and yet, we are still asking the same questions. We were interested in adapting the play to feature the original story, but help it sound and feel more contemporary.

3. Why now?

Fearless has successfully produced Dog Sees God by Burt Royal and The Stonewater Rapture by Doug Wright. For our third production, we wanted to be even more ambitious with a new adaptation that will feature a large cast and creative team as well as an exchange with another amazing partnered organization,  Empowerment Performance Project (YEPP).

4. What’s YEPP?

YEPP is an organization dedicated to providing a safe environment for LGBTQ youth experiencing homelessness and is investigating new ways to address their struggles, and celebrate their strengths by developing a performance. Not only will Spring Awakening raise awareness and funds for this awesome group of young artists, we will also engage in an arts exchange with the members of the ensemble. YEPP members will help us build the play and will also co-lead post-show panel discussions once the show opens.

5. Where does the money go?

Our basic expenses include rehearsal and performance spaces, costumes, set, and insurance. We are also committed to paying our artists a small stipend for all of their hard work on this production. Once our finances are met, we will donate the remaining expenses to YEPP. 

6. When and Where will it be?

We are so excited to be performing in the Charnel House (a renovated Mortuary) at 3421 W. Fullerton Ave. Performances will be April 9 - April 26, Thursday - Sunday at 7:30pm.

story:
The M.A.C.Y Scholarship Campaign

  •  Theater and Arts Students are overlooked for scholarships.
  • Your donations created 500 awards and 17 scholarships.
  • Your recognition will be remembered for life. 

The M.A.C.Y. Awards gives high school students the opportunity to take their love for theater to a higher education. With your support, their lives will be changed. 

D'Arcy Green our 2014 winner says, "This opportunity has made me a better person and performer. It has inspired me to work even harder to conquer my future goals. I could not have asked for a better way to close out my high school career."

Theater students don't receive the recognition they deserve.

  • Arts education improves all academic performance. 35% higher in math.
  • 95% of theater students go on to a 4 year college, versus 64% of others.
  • When they succeed, we need to recognize them for a job well done.
  • Successful students don't just happen. They are nurtured, trained, and most of all; recognized and encouraged.

Our Goal 

  • Every dollar goes directly to a student in need of a scholarship to achieve their higher education. 
  • Scholarships are sent directly to the college for each student ensuring all donations directly go to a student's education.

The Impact

Crowd funding allows each of us to participate in the arts when budget cuts are threatened. 

About M.A.C.Y. 

www.macyawards.com

M.A.C.Y. Awards is a 501c3 Non-Profit volunteer organization. 100% of your donations are tax deductible. 

The top Actor and Actress will once again be sent to New York to represent M.A.C.Y in the "National High School Musical Theater Awards". www.nhsmta.com

For over 45 years, The Childress M.A.C.Y. Awards has granted over 19,000 awards and scholarships! Your donation will be remembered throughout their lives and allow Arts Education to continue in our schools. 

The 45th Annual Childress M.A.C.Y. Awards will be held at Segerstrom Center on Sunday, May 31,  2015 at 12:00 PM. Please come join us.

None of this would be possible without your support.

Thank you again!

Childress M.A.C.Y. Awards.

Wayne Odekirk, President 951 836-2468

story:
Woyzeck: The Human Experiment is the world's first live action video game adaptation of George Buchner's classic play Woyzeck where the audience rearranges the scenes in real time by interacting on their smartphones!

To elaborate: Buchner's piece from 1837 is heralded as one of the world's first modern plays because of its stark and fragmentary form, and artists and audiences over the past 100 years have been drawn to this piece with its vast plurality of messages and meanings. The scenes themselves have no clear-cut order and can be rearranged in a wide variety of ways.

In order to really explore the vast variety of stories and themes nested within this piece we have to let the audience do just that: explore them. In our production we have devised a system where, by means of constant polling and gaming, the audience determines the order of the events in real time, allowing for the investigation of the entire world of possible narratives rather than a marriage to just one. The audience not only picks which scenes come next, but even determines which events happen within each scene and how the characters respond to them; the entire structure of the play, from the actors to the blocking to the design elements, responds to these choices in real time creating a piece that is customized to each audience on each night. 

We’re trying to raise $7,000! We have already brought some of our own money to the table and have had many generous donors help us through the start-up phase of this project. You’re probably asking — well, where’s my money going? Here’s how we’re spending it:

$4,000 goes to SALARIES! For our performers, designers, stage managers, technicians and stagehands.

  • $1,400 goes to our performers
  • $1,400 goes to our designers and their assistants
  • $600 goes to our stage management team
  • $600 goes to our technicians who will construct and load in the show’s set, and light and sound systems

$1,000 goes to Budgets for our scenic and costume designers to purchase materials to fabricate their brilliant designs

$400 goes to Budgets for our lighting and sound designers to rent lighting and sound equipment that can work with our interactive voting system

$700 goes to a marketing budget that will help us develop an audience

$700 goes to salaries and resources to develop a smartphone voting system that can interact with our lighting and sound systems in the theater

That last item is critical because this will all be made possible by an elaborate software we're designing which processes dozens of signals from each audience member, evaluates their decisions and then sifts through all the subsequent narrative possibilities to find the ones that make the most dramatic sense based off of the audience's previous input. That way, no matter what the audience wants to have happen, the piece responds in a way that furthers an artistic dialogue rather than devolving into a meandering choose-your-own-adventure. We believe that this type of interactive experience is absolutely necessary to effectively communicate with new audiences in this age of digital connectivity and personalization.

The software we hope to eventually build is incredibly complex, and to fully flesh it out requires much more time and money. In this limited engagement we hope to use our resources to develop a highly functional prototype of the system to see if at it's core it is an engaging experience. If so, we hope to seriously continue developing this on a larger scale with high quality documentation of this version serving as serious proof of concept for further steps.


We deeply appreciate any and all contributions you'd be willing to make to our crazy and harebrained endeavor.


Can't join the circus this time? Here's what you CAN do:

  • Share the fun on Twitter and Facebook!
  • Step right up to a performance, tickets start at $12 and can be purchased at https://www.artful.ly/store/events/5974
  • Join us! If you're interested in helping out with production in any capacity, we'd love to hear from you. Reach out to jessica@themeshnyc.org.

story:
Short Summary

This choreography was a huge succes in Budapest last year at the Evening of the Young Hungarian Choreographers held in the National Dance Theatre and we are very pleased that it was selected for the 2015 DUMBO Dance Festival .

Feledi Project ( www.felediproject.com ) was established by Feledi János choreographer and dancer. He graduated at the Hungarian Dance Academy in 2003 and started his career as a member of Győri Ballet, working as a solo dancer and choreographer. After mastering in ballet he became the member of PR-Evolution and BaDora Dance Companies. He presented his first own choreography in 2010 the moment when the Feledi Project was born. So far he has created 7 full-evening length works, all of which are constantly on schedule in the National Dance Theater, Szkéné Theater and all the famous Hungarian festivals with sold out tickets. The company and the project is characterized by high level skills, excellent artistic composure, professionalism, energy and uniqueness. His choreographies are mature, excitingly themed, they combine classical ballet and modern dance in a unique way. The quality work in his performances earned the enthusiasts' love and acknowledgement. As an acknowledgement in 2014 Feledi Project was chosen to be a member of the Hungarian Dance Association and the Society of Hungarian Choreographers.

 This short piece (Breathing together) is about the most essential relation: between man and woman, men and women. It tries to capture the moment when people and the background melts together around them.


We need your support to get to NYC and we are happy to THANK!!!

  • My choreography was selected for the New York Dumbo Festival 2015 ( http://www.whitewavedance.com/stay-tuned-2015-dumbo-dance-festival/ )
  • As the festival program is free for the public, they are unable to support our travel and stay in New York. That is why we are looking for your funds. Please help us to get to New York
  • Our aim is to raise 3.000 USD, that would cover the  travel for the two dancers and the choreographer and technical personnel. 

  • Breakdown:

    TRAVEL (round-trip to NYC for 4 people)

    $2.000 ($500 x4 by air from Budapest Hungary)

    METRO CARDS (help us get around NYC)

    $120 ($30 pass per person)

    LODGING ()

    $880 (4 people - 4 night stay in NYC)

    TOTAL FUNDS NEEDED: $3,000

  • Your generosity will help get us to New York City - and for that we have some perks to send your way! Look to the right and check out what we have waiting for you! We will thank each contribution and those who give at least 25 USD will get a signed photo. We are happy to send a signed DVD to those who support us with at least 100 USD.

The Impact

Your support would help us to get international exposure to our company and also a chance to meet and see young and innovative dance companies from all over the world. It gives some of our dancers the opportunity to interact with other people in the industry, outside of our home area. An event like this can easily lead to future travel performance opportunities, or even help us find new donors and funders to help us continue to present these great works.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Send our fund raising campaign to your friends and associates on facebook or other social media. Encourage them to donate. Even 5 USD can make a difference. Every little counts.

The festival will take place 8-11 October 2015, please feel free to COME and ENJOY the various dance performances (hopefully including us) from all over the word. This way you HELP keeping the contemporary dance alive!!!  :-)) http://www.whitewavedance.com/stay-tuned-2015-dumbo-dance-festival/

story:
Hi there! Come on in, grab a drink, take a seat, the show's about to begin...

Who Am I? (24601!)

My name is Angus Wyatt and I am the Executive Producer and Co-Founder of Masters of Show Choir - the UK's university show choir competition. I have spent the past 6 years working in media and event production, as well as gaining a degree in Geography and Politics.

Masters of the House? Masters of War? Masters of Reality? What is it?

In 2010 I started a show choir at my university in response to the rising popularity of the hit TV show Glee. We then started to see similar groups popping up all over the UK, but they had no forum to meet, showcase their performances or compete against each other - cue light bulb moment, and the creation of Masters of Show Choir in 2012

The competition is now made up of choirs from 8 different universities from across the UK. Each choir consists of about 20 performers, with the show therefore involving about 160 18-24 year olds from a variety of backgrounds and regions. The format of the competition involves accompanied singing, a cappella singing and choreography. Our key objective of the competition, and the reason why we do what we do is to connect young people (18-24) from all over the UK, uniting them through their shared love of performing and the show choir form, giving them a creative outlet in order to develop their talent, performance abilities and key life skills.

Four years on from the first Masters of Show Choir, we are now hoping to develop and grow the competition by bringing it to London for it's fifth birthday in 2016. Funding from you now would enable us to secure the future of the competition and develop its national status, in turn making it accessible to individuals and choirs from more regions and increasingly diverse backgrounds.

We need a dollar, dollar, dollar is what we need (but GBP preferred please)...

We are asking all of you wonderful people to help us to raise £2500. That money, combined with ticket revenues from the past few years, will ensure the future of the competition and enable us to find a more permanent home for the show in a suitable theatre. As an idea of why we need £2500, theatre hire alone can cost up to £5000 just for one day. So your money would go directly towards venue hire, marketing, and our development fund for future years. Our team (myself included) and the show's band are only paid expenses, so rest assured that your money will not be going into anyone's pockets.

What ya gonna do?

Theatre and live performances are often expensive to attend, especially in Central London. Imagine being able to go to a show for just a £15 donation, in the knowledge that you've just enabled hundreds of students to perform, make friends and develop their confidence. We have a range of perks available as a thank you to all our donors, from tickets to signed programmes and from public acknowledgement to hospitality packages. Plus, if you're super generous, you'll be recognised as a contributor to the future success of the UK's show choir competition - who knows, it could be the next X Factor, so don't miss out on your chance to be a part of it! 

Falling out of reach

Of course, we may not reach £2500, so what happens then? All money raised by the end of the campaign will still go towards growing and developing the competition, so it will never go to waste. We will also still fulfil all perks for those who have donated because we really do appreciate whatever we get.

Money's too tight to mention

If you want to be involved but can't contribute right now, then you can still really help us by telling everyone you know about our campaign and asking them if they'll consider donating. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, or post the link to our page on your social media channels. You can also contact us to offer other goods or services such as poster and programme printing, or awards.

Of course, we may not reach £2500, so what happens then? All money raised by the end of the campaign will still go towards growing and developing the competition, so it will never go to waste. We will also still fulfil all perks for those who have donated because we really do appreciate whatever we get.
Money's too tight to mention

If you want to be involved but can't contribute right now, then you can still really help us by telling everyone you know about our campaign and asking them if they'll consider donating. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, or post the link to our page on your social media channels. You can also contact us to offer other goods or services such as poster and programme printing, or awards.

story:
Co-founded in 2010 by Artistic Director Kat Richter, The Lady Hoofers Tap Ensemble has grown from 2 dancers to 10 including a First Company & Apprentices, plus a youth ensemble ranging from 6 to 15 dancers annually. In just five short years, we have performed at Philadelphia's City Hall, The Kimmel Center, The Forrest Theatre, The Wilma Theatre, Suzanne Roberts Theater, Adrienne Theater, The Trocadero, as well as offering free community performances and touring throughout New Jersey and the greater Philadelphia area.

Currently under the direction of Richter and Managing Director Katie Budris, the mission of The Lady Hoofers Tap Ensemble is to provide educational resources and professional performance opportunities, particularly for women, to promote the art of rhythm tap.

Upcoming Projects: As we grow, we need your help to sustain our momentum! We have several new and ongoing projects in the works, but we can't complete them all without your support. Here's a look at what we're up to...


Residency Program at Moffett Elementary School:
Supported by The Bartol Foundation, Mascher Space Coop, and Access to the Arts, this fall we will enter our third year residency offering tap classes to 5th graders at Moffett Elementary School. This program provides tap shoes for every student and extends an opportunity for 60+ students to experience the arts in spite of budget cuts taking extra-curriculars away from their school. First Company dancer Deedee Mann will be directing next year's program and has ambitious ideas to expand our outreach education.

Tap Short Film:
Taking our choreography to another level, we have begun preparation for our first cinematic project. Conceived and directed by Production Associate/First Company Dancer Meg Sarachan, "Dollar" is a narrative music video combining contemporary music by Aloe Blacc with a vintage theme of the 1940's working woman. By exploring the struggle of women who kept the economy going during World War II, we seek to convey the role women have played in the work force throughout time and the struggle many of us still face today to compete in a male dominant world. In conjunction with Steel River Playhouse, filming will provide interdisciplinary educational opportunities for students to learn about filmmaking, dance, and music.

Master Classes:
Not only do we offer weekly open company classes for adults, but we are committed to bringing master instructors from New York City and beyond for all ages and levels, making high-quality tap accessible to dancers in Philly who may not be able to travel. Past instructors have included Roxane Butterfly, Karen Callaway Williams, Andrew Nemr, and Sarah Mason. We are in communication with several of today's hottest tappers in hopes of continuing our master class series.

Unfortunately, due to the recent closure of Dance/UP, many of the grants and performance opportunities that we have participated in over the last few years no longer exist. Ticket sales only cover a portion of our production costs, so we rely on individual donors like you to keep raising the profile of rhythm tap in Philadelphia.


Your tax-deductible donation will be used to:

  • continue the projects outlined above

  • cover rehearsal space fees and costumes

  • bring in guest artists for performances and educational opportunities

  • choreographer and dancer fees

  • scholarships for students to attend master classes and participate in our youth company

story:
He was more myth than man. His fiction was more plausible than his life. His name was Ernest Hemingway, perhaps the most famous writer of the 20th century.

The four women, whom he would love, marry, and abandon knew him better than he knew himself. Introducing Hemingway’s Wife, an original musical telling Hemingway’s life story through his relationship with the women in his life. 

Book, music, and lyrics by Erin Murray Quinlan, Hemingway’s Wife is very special - a lovely, sweet, powerful, and funny play about one of the 20th Century’s most complicated figures. The play will have its world premiere on May 29 at the Players Ring Theater in Portsmouth, New Hampshire. The show runs for three weekends, ending with a matinee performance on Sunday, June 14, at 3 pm.

Musicals, especially musicals which take place over four decades and across five continents, are expensive. Hemingway’s Wife needs to raise $2000 to pay for musicians, costumes, and props.

For every $25 donated, you can receive a CD of the play’s original score, recorded in mid-May by the original cast. For $50, you will receive the compact disc, and a special collection of The Complete Short Stories of Ernest Hemingway, autographed by cast members. For every donation of $10, you can have a signed poster.Your name will also be published in our program, and watch this space for news on several special books donated and signed by generous friends of the production. We’ll announce those books and authors in future updates, as the production gets closer.  

Come back here for more pictures, videos, and songs. And, don’t forget to reserve your seats for Hemingway’s Wife by calling the box office at 603-436-8123, or visit the Players’ Ring website at www.playersring.org

story:
What is Ibuka & Who Benefits

Ibuka Dance Foundation, a not-for-profit organization, provides a scholarship training program called "A Chance to Dance" for talented young East Africans from disadvantaged backgrounds. Ibuka is the Swahili word meaning "to rise", and we believe that anyone regardless of socioeconomic class can rise through Dance! In Tanzania, there is much untapped talent; dancers lack professional training and opportunities. Our mission is to secure a place in society for dance to be accepted as a profession, requiring full time dedication to attain an international level worthy of funding and support. We serve as a hub for dance to promote and preserve culture in East Africa, and provide a much needed space for dance to be taught, created and performed.

You can learn more about us at ibukadance.org.

                                  

Ibuka, Rise again Stronger!

Our dance center was destroyed in a storm on March 31, only a month after its Grand Opening.  We are asking for funds to rebuild our venue.

The Ibuka center was not only a training studio but a performance venue that quickly became central to the community. We hosted 2 large shows featuring Ibuka repertoire, international guest companies,  and the most dedicated students from the newly launched "A Chance to Dance" program.

The original tent, amphitheater and offices on the Ibuka compound.

Severe weather and faulty construction, both all too common here, caused the structure to fall. No one was hurt but the damage was irreparable. 

               

The dance space as it looks now with the wreckage cleared. 

Creating opportunity from disaster, we held a fundraising show in the unique setting of the wreckage. Everyone involved volunteered, allowing us to raise the first $1,000 toward rebuilding. (Please click here to view our other video including footage of the show)

GMP Engineering, the most reputable architecture firm in Arusha, was moved by our performance a few days before the collapse and donated a new theater design for the Ibuka Dance Center:

Fred Nnko of TF Developments is offering his contracting services pro-bono, and in exchange... he just wants to learn the Argentinian Tango!

New Dance Center Features:

  • 150 square-meter dance floor
  • Outdoor amphitheater seating for 300 people
  • Accessible roads and parking
  • Professional quality light and sound

Rebuilding Costs:

  • Construction of new Structure (parts and labor): $10,000
  • Drains and outdoor toilet: $3,000
  • Lights: $3,000
  • Sound System: $3,000
  • Generator: $2,000
  • Floor (parts and labor): $6,000
  • Dance Equipment (barres, mirrors): $600
  • Access (road, driveway, parking, signs): $5,000
  • Improvements using re-purposed materials from the old structure (sound booth, backstage changing room, audience shade cover): $2,400
  • Total: $35,000
  • Already Raised: $5,000 (fundraiser show, 2 charity quiz night show proceeds, local community donations)
  • Remaining: $30,000
We will build the new structure first and continue with the remaining necessities as funds are received. We have used locally-raised funds to begin purchasing materials and building.

 

Ibuka's Impact


Arusha is a pivotal fast-growing town in the heart of  East Africa, and is the seat of the East African Community. As it thrives on safari tourism, support for the arts is minimal, and Ibuka is a key player in this emerging field. With a shortage of cultural institutions and an abundance of talent, Tanzania has inspired Ibuka to establish a hub for culture, creating a network and a space for artists in East Africa. 
Our training program feeds into our dance company and creates top level dancers and teachers, who then disseminate dance through our outreach workshops and educational pieces. We support the community projects by performing at commercial events and functions, and by teaching the general public with our daily open classes at the centre. All the pieces of the puzzle fit together, and each branch of Ibuka supports the others. It is an ideal model for a sustainable cultural organization that enriches society through promoting and preserving traditions, creating cross-cultural bridges and alliances, and through education and employment.
Outreach Workshops & Edutainment

Ibuka creates dance pieces that provide community education, addressing issues such as violence, environmental issues, gender equality, and health, which are often difficult or taboo to talk about. We do workshops with children based on the theme of the performance they viewed, using non-verbal communication as a powerful tool for healing, understanding, expression, and social change. We call this "Dance Activism" and have done outreach at children's homes, orphanages, schools and community centers.

To date, we’ve given more than a dozen community outreach workshops. From the biggest slum in Nairobi to a home for Maasai girls who escaped child marriage, we have reached over 500 of society's most vulnerable people to date with this work. 


Professional Dance Training

 Through "A Chance to Dance" program, we aim to educate, nurture and mentor emerging talent and teach them that dance is a sustainable and real profession only just starting to become recognized in Africa. Their daily classes include ballet, contemporary, traditional African dance, and yoga. Workshops in the future are planned with invited guest teachers, artists in residencies, and choreographers. We develop trainees' confidence and professionalism, giving them jobs through performing and teaching.

  • Currently we have 12 Tanzanian dance trainees ages 15-19 years in the training program.
  • By the year 2020, we plan on having trained 50 dancers to be selected into the Ibuka dance company or access a variety of jobs in the arts.
  • We  have 10 full time staff organizing and dancing for the foundation, and plan to create 10 more jobs in the next year.
  • Students will receive a certificate on completion of the first year, and we are working toward offering a diploma. By 2017 we aim to have set up a Dance degree program with the local university, Makumira. 

Our students continue training and rehearsing, in spite of the temporary lack of a proper facility.


Performances

Ibuka’s choreography is a fusion of African and contemporary dance, and explores relevant concepts that are meaningful and moving to both the dancers and the audience. Whether we are performing at a community event, an international dance festival, or our own venue, we speak to audiences through the universal language of movement. We are one of four partners in the creation and implementation of AMDA (Afrika Mashariki Dance Network) linking Dar Es Salaam, Arusha, Nairobi, and Kigali, and we will be hosting the first ever Ibuka International Contemporary Dance Festival in Arusha in October 2015. 

Performance Credits Include:

  • East African Nights of Tolerance, International Dance Festival  (Kigali, Rwanda)
  • Time 2 Dance Festival ( Dar, Tanzania )
  • United Nations WFP, commissioned piece on malnutrition (Dar, TZ)
  • Alliance Francaise, forum on sustainability performance (Arusha, TZ)


Behind the Scenes

Ibuka was founded by Canadian Anna Bussey in April 2014. She graduated with honors from the ballet high school of Les Grand Ballets Canadiens in Montreal and went on scholarship to the renowned John-Cranko Shule academy of the Stuttgart Ballet (Germany) and completed her dance education with a degree at the Rotterdam Dansacademie (Holland). She has danced and taught in world class companies such as:  The Copenhagen International Ballet (Denmark), La Compagnie Thor (Belgium), the Cirque du Soleil (Canada) and Compagnia Zappala Danza (Italy).

                                           

After 3 decades of thriving as a dancer in the West, she knew it was her time to give back, and realized that the opportunities she had received in Canada and Europe throughout her dance education and career were not a reality for the talented, tenacious and inspirational artists she met in Africa. After many return visits to Tanzania, initially to visit her sister who lived in Arusha,  Anna took the initiative to fulfill her vision and fill a cultural gap, and she began mobilizing people to create a center for dance and the performing arts. 

                                 

She is dedicated to building a platform for a dance community to thrive and giving performing artists a structure required to reach their maximum potential.  The momentum that this has gathered in the East African community has been remarkable over the past year, showing Ibuka's team we are on the right path and that an infrastructure for dance is indeed sorely needed. We are inspiring each other!

Anna choreographing in the original space before the rainy season began...


Pamoja, Swahili for Together

Pamoja, we can rise! Your involvement gives these incredible young artists a chance to dance!

Whether big or small, your donation will go directly to rebuilding a home for dance for so many, so that they can reach their full potential.

Finally, some good news from Africa! The rebuilding of a pioneering Tanzanian theater from the ground up is about to happen right now, with you! So please be the change you want to see, make your money matter, and receive some wonderful perks in the process, like an Ibuka Dance calendar and a place on our plaque at the new venue. 

Another great way to help us reach our crowd funding goal is to spread the word to your family, friends, and people you know who are committed to changing the world for better through art.

Sharing is caring, so please take a moment to do so through Facebook, Twitter, e-mail and the Indiegogo share tools. Ibuka cannot rise alone!

With Heartfelt gratitude from the whole Ibuka Dance Team

THANK YOU!

story:
Free Lunch Academy is a non-profit artistic outreach program that is dedicated to deterring violence, diminishing bullying, and mentoring students through the use of performance arts. Founded in October of 2012 by Creative Director, Calvin King,
who sought to provide students in Chicago with the necessary tools to safely
mediate the occurrence of violence and bullying that is too often experienced
in classrooms, through artistic expression. Our programs are designed to both
entertain and educate students on various methods that can be used to safely
resolve issues of anger, resentment and threats of violence.
One way in which this objective is reached is by partnering with schools throughout the Chicagoland area to provide their students with the one of a kind stage
experience known affectionately as, “The Greatest Teacher” (anti-bullying stage
play). To date we have performed at over 25 different schools in the city of Chicago and we have received such tremendous feedback from our school partnerships and their students. We want to continue our efforts by growing our number of school performances and take “The Greatest Teacher” on the road. However, producing these shows across the Chicagoland area can be quite expensive -from transportation costs, video editing, branding material, and student giveaways.  
Our goal for this campaign is to raise $15,000 in 45 days to cover all
costs related to successfully producing our show, The Greatest Teacher, during the 2015-16 academic school. The funds raised will help us produce an awesome show for students who need it most, at no cost to them! Through your support we can reach over fifty (50) schools, that's at least  20,000 students in the Chicagoland area! Bullying is a issue, and far too many times it is looked over. We believe there is an indirect correlation between the rise in bullying and the increase in violence our city has been experiencing over the last few years.
 
 
What You Can Expect From Us
Throughout this campaign we will work hard to provide you with updates on our progress via e-mail and video updates. We have designed a few perks that speak to various donor levels; from $15-$5,000, and we hope you find them as awesome as we do! Whether we raise and exceed our goal amount of $15,000, every cent matters! So please check these out!
By supporting this campaign, you are not only supporting the talent of our performers, but supporting a movement that can ultimately change the lives of our youth. If we can only produce one show and touch one life, we have succeeded.
 
More info on the show:
“The Greatest Teacher” is a multi media stage performance centered around Anti-Bullying techniques and aimed at inspiring today’s youth. “The Greatest Teacher” takes a refreshing interactive – approach to focusing on the coming of age issues
experienced by most students attempting to balance the pressures of school,
home and social life while on a roller coaster ride of self discovery. 
“The Greatest Teacher” is a must see for any student; be it a bully, a victim,
or the all too common bystander. Contact us for more information on how we can bring "The Greatest Teacher" to your school! www.freelunchacademy.com | freelunchacademy@gmail.com

Founded in October of 2012 by Creative Director, Calvin King,who sought to provide students in Chicago with the necessary tools to safelymediate the occurrence of violence and bullying that is too often experiencedin classrooms, through artistic expression. Our programs are designed to bothentertain and educate students on various methods that can be used to safelyresolve issues of anger, resentment and threats of violence. 
One way in which this objective is reached is by partnering with schools throughout the Chicagoland area to provide their students with the one of a kind stageexperience known affectionately as, “The Greatest Teacher” (anti-bullying stageplay). To date we have performed at over 25 different schools in the city of Chicago and we have received such tremendous feedback from our school partnerships and their students. We want to continue our efforts by growing our number of school performances and take “The Greatest Teacher” on the road. However, producing these shows across the Chicagoland area can be quite expensive -from transportation costs, video editing, branding material, and student giveaways.  
Our goal for this campaign is to raise $15,000 in 45 days to cover allcosts related to successfully producing our show, The Greatest Teacher, during the 2015-16 academic school. The funds raised will help us produce an awesome show for students who need it most, at no cost to them! Through your support we can reach over fifty (50) schools, that's at least  20,000 students in the Chicagoland area! Bullying is a issue, and far too many times it is looked over. We believe there is an indirect correlation between the rise in bullying and the increase in violence our city has been experiencing over the last few years. 

 
 
What You Can Expect From Us Throughout this campaign we will work hard to provide you with updates on our progress via e-mail and video updates. We have designed a few perks that speak to various donor levels; from $15-$5,000, and we hope you find them as awesome as we do! Whether we raise and exceed our goal amount of $15,000, every cent matters! So please check these out!By supporting this campaign, you are not only supporting the talent of our performers, but supporting a movement that can ultimately change the lives of our youth. If we can only produce one show and touch one life, we have succeeded.  
More info on the show:

“The Greatest Teacher” is a multi media stage performance centered around Anti-Bullying techniques and aimed at inspiring today’s youth. “The Greatest Teacher” takes a refreshing interactive – approach to focusing on the coming of age issuesexperienced by most students attempting to balance the pressures of school,home and social life while on a roller coaster ride of self discovery. “The Greatest Teacher” is a must see for any student; be it a bully, a victim,or the all too common bystander. Contact us for more information on how we can bring "The Greatest Teacher" to your school! www.freelunchacademy.com | freelunchacademy@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever gone to a stand-up comedy show and had such a good time that you wished it would never end?

Well, have we got a show for you!  Beginning April 12, 2015, at The East Room in Nashville, TN, the NashvilleStandUp comedy scene, friends and special guests will attempt to break the Guinness world record for the "Longest stand-up comedy show - multiple comedians.” The current record is 80 hours and was achieved by the Laugh Factory in Hollywood December 6-9, 2010. That show included 170 different acts by 150 comedians. 

We plan on breaking their 3.3 day / 80 hour record and continuing through the entire duration of the Wild West Comedy Festival until April 19th. That’s 8 days, 192 non-stop hours of stand-up comedy featuring as many talented comedians from as many places as we can manage. 

The brainchild of Nashville-based comic DJ Buckley, the Guinness World Records' breaking attempt show will begin and end with The East Room's weekly “Spiffy Squirrel comedy show” with Chad Riden on Sunday nights & also include Tuesday’s regular “ULTIMATE COMEDY” open mic and several other shows-within-the-show. The non-stop 192 hour schedule will feature showcases, feature length and headliner length sets and surprise drop-ins from comedians of various levels of fame and fortune AND infamy and misfortune. 


WHAT!? NO! Why?

The Nashville Comedy scene wants nothing more than to put Nashville into the record books of comedy history, but we can't do it without you. Comedy shows can be fun no matter how intimate the crowd, but this will certainly go much better with you there. Wait, what's that? You can't make it to Nashville, because you're too far away and it's expensive? No need to worry, we have plans to live stream the event. Yes, all eight days of it. We’d also love to film a documentary about all of this, too,  but that’s going to take money.. and we are a group of poor dummies who thought it was a good idea to do comedy for a living. 


HOW?

We do have smart, creative friends who are willing to help make all of this happen. We want to cover their expenses and gather the resources we need to do this right. We want to make laminates, print up swag and buy some SD cards for video cameras and be able to staff the venue and run the show non-stop for 192 hours! Also, there is a rather large fee to have the Guinness people send an official representative out to judge the world record attempt. WE WILL DO THIS NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENS, but we would much rather do it with your support so we can do it RIGHT.

We have launched this IndieGoGo crowd-funding campaign to help pay for this event. Perks include VIP passes, special silk screened show t-shirts, limited edition Hatch Show Print show posters, even chances to perform on stage and be included in the Guinness book of world records. Also, you'll have an all-access pass to see multiple hosts and hundreds of comics driven to madness by a relentless amount of comedy as many times as you want. 

Nashville StandUp is a non-profit organization (more specifically, a 509(a)(2) Public Charity) with a mission to cultivate and promote middle Tennessee’s growing stand-up comedy scene and the Nashville-based comedians that help make it a success. Check your qualified income tax professional about the tax deductible status of your charitable donation. 


Risks & Challenges

Our plan is bullet-proof. We've all promised each other that we'll never, ever not completely follow through with this. That said, God is cruel and here are several ways he could possibly smote us: 

  • Some dumb comedian bails on his set and walks off or doesn't show.
  • The East Room is destroyed by terrorists who hate freedom and comedy.
Here is how we beat the odds and do this anyway: 
  • We'll have an Emergency Back-Up Comedian on deck at all times. 
  • We will rise from the ashes and continue to sling zingers in the debris. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Volunteer to help! We'll need a/v people, merch booth people, etc
  • SHOW UP at the show! We need butts in the seats. Everybody will be much more comfortable with a full audience.
  • Join the NashvilleStandUp.com mailing list & follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & YouTube. 
  • Steal money from some richie rich person who doesn't deserve what they have and THEN contribute with THAT money. 
  • Wherever you live, go find the local comedy shows and comedians and support them. The super famous incredible “breakout” comics of 10-15 years from now are trying standup comedy for the first time ever this week and you could be there to see them.
Thank you very much for donating and we hope to see you at the show!
More info at NashvilleStandUp.com/WorldRecord/

story:
(Poco a poco se irá actualizando♥)
~IMPORTANTE~
Si alguien prefiriese pagar en euros, contactad a través de
seiravoneinzbern@gmail.com
@_HeavenlySound
Agradecemos a @halfy314 y a @automatonNick por corregir los textos y las traducciones al inglés♥

✿Cherry Blossom Sparkle✿

Cherry Blossom Sparkle somos un grupo almeriense que empezó con tres chicas con ganas de promover la cultura idol proveniente de Japón, con el objetivo de animar al público y hacer espectáculos en los Salones del Manga y convenciones que se celebran en España.

De modo que, para ganar adeptos, optamos por interpretar papeles de personajes de algún anime que estuviese relacionado con esta cultura, así escogimos "Love Live School Idol Project". Una vez reunidas 9 chicas para ocupar los papeles, hemos estado ensayando las coreografías y cómo actuar para hacerlo lo mejor posible.

=======================================================

Cherry Blossom Sparkle is a group from Almeria that started with three girls who wanted to promote Japanese idol culture, with the aim of performing at manganime conventions held in Spain.

So, to gain supporters, they chose to play some anime characters that were related to this culture. They decided to use the idols from "Love Live School Idol Project". After nine girls gathered to fill the roles, they've been rehearsing the choreographies and practicing to do their best.

Las chicas || The cast


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes || What we need and what you get

El mayor problema surgido es causado por los vestuarios, al ser 9, no todas cuentan con el fondo económico necesario para poder pagárselos y por eso se recurre a la opción de crowdfunding, aparte de recaudar el dinero, nos daríamos más a conocer.

Con la financiación pedida (500USD) podríamos hacernos cargo de:

  • Los vestuarios de las chicas que no se lo pueden financiar.
  • Ayudar económicamente con el traslado de algunas chicas, que no son de la provincia y son indispensables por su talento.
  • Merchandising: queremos comercializar con nuestra imagen y así no volver a depender de un crowdfunding, que supone un esfuerzo para todo el mundo, a la par que seguir promocionándonos.

Tened en cuenta que si se llega a la meta de 500$, nunca recibiremos ese dinero íntegro debido a las tasas e impuestos que genera hacer un crowdfunding.
=======================================================
The biggest problem encountered is due to the outfits. Not all of us have the money necessary for paying them, so we have to turn to crowdfunding, as besides raising the money, it'll help make ourselves better known.

With the requested funding (500USD) we could take care of:

  • The costumes for the girls that cannot buy them themselves.

  • Help transport some girls who aren't from the province and are needed for their talent.

  • Merchandising: we want to commercialize our image, and thus not have to rely on crowdfunding. At the same time we want to keep promoting ourselves.

If we reach the goal of 500USD, keep in mind that we will never receive all of the money due to fees and taxes generated by making a crowdfunding.

El impacto || The impact

Nuestro objetivo es participar como animadoras en lo mayormente posible de eventos manganime que haya en España, marcando un hito ya que anteriormente no se ha hecho una actividad como esta, de tal calibre.

Con vuestra colaboración, conseguiremos aumentar nuestra credibilidad, ya que una buena presencia es un gran factor, sumando que nos daremos más a conocer con la promoción de este crowdfunding.

Contamos con el respaldo de la popularidad de una de las líderes, quien ya tiene experiencia en el mundo del espectáculo y en la cultura idol. Añadiendo que no es la primera vez que servidora organiza un evento, ya que ha participado en la creación de un mercado artesanal y en actividades orientadas a la cultura maid.
=======================================================

Our goal is participate as entertainers in most of manganime conventions in Spain, marking a milestone because there hasn't been much of that kind of activity on our country.
With your help, we will increase our credibility, because a good presence is a big factor, adding that we will become more known due to the promotion of this crowdfunding.
We have the support of one of the leaders, who already has experience in the entertainment world and the idol culture and is rather popular. Adding that it isn't the first time that I organize an event, I took part in the making of a craft market and maid culture oriented activities.

Recompensas || Rewards

Sobre las recompensas, una vez que hayamos adquirido los trajes, nos pondremos de inmediato con la sesión de fotos para que recibais vuestras recompensas lo antes posible. En todo caso, mientras se vayan recibiendo las solicitudes, el merchandising que no sean fotografías, será realizado de inmediato para evitar retrasos.
Poco a poco iremos actualizando con imágenes del merchandising. Ｏ(≧▽≦)Ｏ
========================================================

About rewards, once we've acquired the costumes, we will immediately do a photoshoot so you can receive your rewards as soon as possible. As we get applications for rewards, non-photo merchandising will be crafted immediately to avoid delays.

Step by step, we'll update with pictures of merchandising. O(≧ ▽ ≦)O

Riesgos y desafíos || Risks and Challenges

El mayor riesgo para no conseguir nuestra meta sería no llegar a recaudar todo el dinero que necesitamos. Pero realmente, eso no sería una novedad y nosotras no estamos dispuestas a que eso nos sea un impedimento, así que una vez que comience la campaña, todas haremos la mayor promoción posible (ya a raíz de nuestra gran base de popularidad), incluso pidiendo ayuda a las grandes empresas relacionadas con este mundo. Contamos con el gancho del merchandising de las recompensas, algo asequible y que se facilita su envío a todas partes del país e incluso internacional.
========================================================
There's always the risk that we don't reach the amount of funding we need. But really, that wouldn't be a novelty and we aren't going to give up because of it. Every one of us will promote the campaign as much as possible, even asking large companies for help. We have the hook of merchandising rewards, cheap and easy to deliver across Spain and even internationally.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar || Other ways you can help

Si ves que no puedes ayudar económicamente, aún puedes ayudarnos haciendo promoción y difundiendo este evento para que salga adelante. Te lo agradeceremos de corazón, y si nos lo comunicas, te lo agradeceremos manuscritamente en el tablón de los agradecimientos que pensamos crear.

========================================================
If you see that you can't help financially, you can still help by promoting and sharing this event. We'd appreciate that from the bottom of our heart, and if you show us you've spread information about this campaign, we'll express our gratitude by writing your name on a "Thank you" board we're planning on making.

story:
Remember when you were in the school play?  Remember how you felt with the lights in your eyes and the butterflies in your stomach?  Can you hear the thunderous applause?  Then maybe later on you joined a college group and had some unforgettable experiences working hard towards a performance, what a thrill, right?  Sure, that helped you.  It gave you confidence and maturity and you made friends that have lasted a lifetime. 

Sadly, today’s youngsters will not have that experience.  They will not know what it feels like to belong to a group of people that share a common goal of pulling off the spectacular feat that is live theatre.  Our education and civic budgets are cut to the bare minimum with no room for extras such as theatre programs.  School plays are not being produced, music and art are being slashed from the curriculum.  An entire generation of our kids are not being introduced to theatre arts, music or culture of any kind.  And we at the Glove Performing Arts Center, think that is tragic. 

But, with your help we can do something about it!  We have, right here in Fulton County, New York, a fully functional Theatre just oozing with history and culture.  The theatre turned 100 this year!  As you can imagine, it takes resources to keep these old doors open. We get no funding from the state or local governments, they are stretched to the limit just providing for the basic needs of our community, ranked among the poorest in New York State.  We have been fortunate with some small grants and trusts but nothing like what it takes to keep going.  This grand space could be a solid economic driver for our area but first we need to shine it up and dress it for a big debut!  We have an all-volunteer staff ready to do the job, expecting nothing in return but to enjoy quality entertainment and have the place bursting with kids who we know will be the performers and patrons of tomorrow. 

Please remember your experience being introduced to the performing arts and how much it means to you now and give to help the Glove stay open for the next generation.

Please note up to 15% of funds received will go to costs supporting programming including but not limited to utilities.

story:
presents STRANGEr | AJNABIA : a devised performance piece tracking two characters in search of their identities liberated from their cultures, spanning two languages. The actors, Mohammed and Elizabeth met in 2012 in Bethlehem, Palestine. One is an American raised in Texas and living in California who often feels at home in Palestine. One is a Palestinian living in Cyprus. Both are taking a step back from their cultural identities to question how much of who they are is merely a product of their environment, challenging each other’s claims on truth. How deeply can a Christian American Feminist White actress and an ex-Muslim Atheist Arab actor access each other? What are our unexamined prejudices?  Does it matter? This piece is an experiment in leaving cultural identity behind, picking it back up, and seeing what of value, if anything, remains. STRANGEr will not only confront Elizabeth and Mohammed’s beliefs and identities but also their friends’ and families’ through conducted interviews, aiming to create fictional characters from these merged stories. The characters find themselves stranded on an island and will fall in love only to discover that the divide between them is as vast as the water that separates them from their homelands. In the rehearsal room, Elizabeth and Mohammed will begin by experimenting with dialogue and movement leading themselves through the exercises of Augusto Boal, Viola Spolin, the Viewpoints, and Wangh’s Acrobat of the Heart. STRANGEr will be the culmination of a highly personal process that demands the actors to confront their judgments of themselves and each other in a powerful piece of theater that beckons audiences to open up in a talk-back about their own experiences and fears of the Other. 

STRANGEr | AJNABI will premiere in Riverside, California at the Mad St. space and travel to Chicago to present at the Pedagogy and Theatre of the Oppressed Conference in June! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • $1200 -- Round Trip Flight from Cyprus to Los Angeles for Mohammed
  • $1000 -- Room and Board for Mohammed for one month rehearsing and performing STRANGEr | AJNABI in Southern California
  • $1000 -- 2 Round Trip Flights from Los Angeles to Chicago for Elizabeth & Mohammed to perform STRANGEr | AJNABI for  Pedagogy & Theatre of the Oppressed Conference June 11-14, 2015 
  • $1000 -- Room and Board for the Pedagogy & Theatre of the Oppressed Conference in Chicago 
  • $1000 -- Expenses for STRANGEr | AJNABI Tour in Southern California (Set, Costumes, Props, Programs, Gas Money, Space Needs)
  • $800 -- Payment for Crew, Marketing, and Miscellaneous Expenses

TOTAL = $6000


The Impact

STRANGEr | AJNABI 

  • During a time of incredible strife and assumptions about the Middle East in the USA and vice versa in the Middle East, it's important for us artists to get personal, challenging ourselves and others to reach inside and become aware of their own cultural influences that may lead us to think and act as we do. What do we have in common? How much do our differences really matter?
  • Compass | a performance collective has a commitment to bringing awareness about places experiencing oppression. For the past two years, Elizabeth has traveled to Bethlehem, Palestine to work with Diyar Dance Theatre. Mohammed Awwad, an actor who has worked all over Palestine, Cyprus, and the region, is the perfect person to bring here to the USA to continue that work on Compass' homeland. 
  • Art is the place where big questions should be explored and risks taken. Help us to continue to raise cultural awareness and stir much needed conversations!

Challenges

If we do not raise all of the funding, the quality of our production decreases, and we may have to put the project on hold!  We believe in raising all of the money for our production up front, not relying on ticket sales to fill in the gaps.  Here are some points to ponder when deciding to give:

  • Elizabeth has successfully raised funds for the past three years to travel to Palestine and teach/direct with The Diyar Dance Theatre. Each year her work has strengthened. In 2012, she went to get a lay of the land and establish connections. In 2013, she volunteered heavily with the Bet Lahem Live Festival as well as directing a student written theatre piece titled "palesTime." In 2014, she returned and directed "Me and My Grandma | A Night of Intergenerational Theatre" at a more professional space in Bethlehem, Dar Annadwa. This year, she is transitioning to the stage and bringing Palestine to California!
  • The challenges we face are primarily financial. You may wonder, "How are you planning all of this together when you are thousands of miles apart?" Mohammed and I have weekly Skype meetings where we brainstorm the production and set goals for the next week. Currently we are writing the script, securing performance spaces, and fundraising.
  • Here's a little inside look into our idea for the play: 2 people crash land on a beach with a magical tree that has one bright red apple hanging from it. They are wearing wedding attire. Both have amnesia and do not understand each others' language. They must fall back in love, discovering the daily divides that cultural differences create. How will they shed their expectations and surrender? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with financial help, you can:

  • Post this campaign to Facebook!
  • Come see the show! We'll let you know the dates and times soon.
  • Let us know you care. Artists need encouragement.

Khalas. Yalla! (Enough, let's go!)
